title: England Athletics Hall of Fame
text:
The England Athletics Hall of Fame was launched in 2008 with a panel of experts selecting a list of potential inductees for athletics <a href="sports%20fan">fans</a> and members of the public to vote on. The <a href="Hall%20of%20Fame">Hall of Fame</a> honours those who have made an outstanding contribution to the sport of <a href="Athletics%20%28sport%29">athletics</a> in <a href="England">England</a>. Each year the public is able to vote on a shortlist of <a href="athlete">athlete</a>s who have been put forward for voting by a panel of experts.
The short list for the public to vote on is drawn up on various criteria, including the following:
Chairman of the Hall of Fame panel is <a href="Darren%20Campbell">Darren Campbell</a>. Darren himself won Olympic gold in the 4 × 100 m relay and a silver at 200m. He was also European 100m champion and bronze medallist in the World Championships.
